content:
ServiceHostBase Class

Definition

Extends the ServiceHostBase class to implement hosts that expose custom programming models.

In this Article

public abstract class ServiceHostBase : System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject, IDisposable, System.ServiceModel.IExtensibleObject<System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase>
Inheritance
Object
System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject
ServiceHostBase

Inherited Members

Remarks

Use the ServiceHostBase class to create hosts that provide a custom programming model. The Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) service programming model uses the ServiceHost class.

Special note for Managed C++ users deriving from this class:

  • Put your cleanup code in (On)(Begin)Close (and/or OnAbort), not in a destructor.

  • Avoid destructors; they cause the compiler to auto-generate IDisposable.

  • Avoid non-reference members; they can cause the compiler to auto-generate IDisposable.

  • Avoid finalizers; but if you include one, you should suppress the build warning and call SuppressFinalize(Object) and the finalizer itself from (On)(Begin)Close (and/or OnAbort) to emulate what would have been the auto-generated IDisposable behavior.

Constructors

ServiceHostBase()

Initializes a new instance of the ServiceHostBase class.

protected ServiceHostBase ();

Gets the service authentication behavior.

public System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceAuthenticationBehavior Authentication { get; }
Value
ServiceAuthenticationBehavior

The service authentication behavior.

Authorization

Gets the authorization behavior for the service hosted.

public System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceAuthorizationBehavior Authorization { get; }
Value
ServiceAuthorizationBehavior

The ServiceAuthorizationBehavior for the service hosted.

BaseAddresses

Gets the base addresses used by the hosted service.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<Uri> BaseAddresses { get; }
Value
ReadOnlyCollection<Uri>

A stem.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1 of type Uri that contains the base addresses for the hosted service.

ChannelDispatchers

Gets the collection of channel dispatchers used by the service host.

public System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ChannelDispatcherCollection ChannelDispatchers { get; }
Value
ChannelDispatcherCollection

The ChannelDispatcherCollection that contains the channel dispatchers used by the service host.

CloseTimeout

Gets or sets the interval of time allowed for the service host to close.

public TimeSpan CloseTimeout { get; set; }
Value
TimeSpan

The TimeSpan that specifies the interval of time allowed for the service host to close.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value, in milliseconds, is less than zero or is larger than MaxValue (2,147,483,647 or, in hexadecimal notation, 0X7FFFFFFF).

InvalidOperationException

The host is in an CommunicationState or CommunicationState state and cannot be modified.

ObjectDisposedException

The host is already in a CommunicationState state and cannot be modified.

CommunicationObjectFaultedException

The host is in a CommunicationState state and cannot be modified.

Credentials

Gets the credential for the service hosted.

public System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials Credentials { get; }
Value
ServiceCredentials

The ServiceCredentials for the service hosted.

DefaultCloseTimeout

Gets the default interval of time allowed for the service host to close.

protected override TimeSpan DefaultCloseTimeout { get; }
Value
TimeSpan

The TimeSpan that specifies the default interval of time allowed for the service host to close.

DefaultOpenTimeout

Gets the default interval of time allowed for the service host to open.

protected override TimeSpan DefaultOpenTimeout { get; }
Value
TimeSpan

The TimeSpan that specifies the default interval of time allowed for the service host to open.

Gets the description of the service hosted.

public System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription Description { get; }
Value
ServiceDescription

The ServiceDescription for the hosted service.

Extensions

Gets the extensions for the current specified service host.

public System.ServiceModel.IExtensionCollection<System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase> Extensions { get; }
Value
IExtensionCollection<ServiceHostBase>

An stem.ServiceModel.IExtensionCollection`1 of type ServiceHostBase.

Retrieves the contracts implemented by the service hosted.

Value
IDictionary<String,ContractDescription>

The stem.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 that contains the ContractDescription objects for the service.

ManualFlowControlLimit

Gets or sets the flow control limit for messages received by the service hosted.

public int ManualFlowControlLimit { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The flow control limit for messages received by the service hosted.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value is less than zero.

Remarks

This limit can be incremented using the IncrementManualFlowControlLimit(Int32) method.

Gets or sets the interval of time allowed for the service host to open.

public TimeSpan OpenTimeout { get; set; }
Value

The TimeSpan that specifies the interval of time allowed for the service host to open.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value is less than zero or is larger than MaxValue (2,147,483,647 or, in hexadecimal notation, 0X7FFFFFFF).

InvalidOperationException

The host is in an CommunicationState or CommunicationState state and cannot be modified.

ObjectDisposedException

The host is already in a CommunicationState state and cannot be modified.

CommunicationObjectFaultedException

The host is in a CommunicationState state and cannot be modified.

Methods

AddBaseAddress(Uri)

Adds a base address to the service host.

protected void AddBaseAddress (Uri baseAddress);
baseAddress
Uri

A Uri that contains the base address for services hosted on the current host.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The baseAddress cannot be called.

Remarks

This property allows users extending ServiceHostBase to provide the base address after the host is constructed. AddBaseAddress can be used to add base addresses to an existing host, but throws an exception if the description is already initialized.

AddDefaultEndpoints()

Adds service endpoints for all base addresses in each contract found in the service host with the default binding.

public virtual System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> AddDefaultEndpoints ();
Returns
ReadOnlyCollection<ServiceEndpoint>

A read-only collection of default endpoints.

AddServiceEndpoint(ServiceEndpoint)

Adds the specified service endpoint to the hosted service.

public virtual void AddServiceEndpoint (System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint);
endpoint
ServiceEndpoint

The service endpoint.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

Endpoint is null.

InvalidOperationException

The host is not in a Created or an Opening state or there is no ServiceDescription for the hosted service.

ArgumentException

The Address, Binding, or Contract property is null.

Remarks

When using the method, the service host does a "by-configuration-name" validation on the contract description. In other words, the host verifies that ConfigurationName exists in the list of configuration names of the service contracts implemented by the service. If the validation passes, the description in the ServiceEndpoint is used as it is, even if the ContractDescription reflected from the service is different.

As an example, assume that the description in the ServiceEndpoint and the contract description reflected from the service have the same name, but different operation behaviors. The implication of only “by-configuration-name” validation is that there is no validation that the behaviors are the same and there are one updates to one description because of another description.

If the address is a relative URI, one of the base addresses of the ServiceHost (depending on the binding protocol) is used as the endpoint's base address.

AddServiceEndpoint(String,Binding,String)

Adds a service endpoint to the hosted service with a specified contract, binding, and endpoint address.

public System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint AddServiceEndpoint (string implementedContract, System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding binding, string address);
implementedContract
String

The contract implemented by the endpoint.

binding
Binding

The Binding for the endpoint added.

address
String

The address for the endpoint added. This can be an absolute or relative URI. If it is a relative URI, one of the base address of the ServiceHost (depending on the binding protocol) is used as the endpoint's base address.

Returns
ServiceEndpoint

The ServiceEndpoint added to the hosted service.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

implementedContract or binding or address or is null.

InvalidOperationException

The host is not in a CommunicationState or an CommunicationState state or there is no ServiceDescription for the hosted service and so an endpoint cannot be added or the binding lacks a transport of binding scheme.

AddServiceEndpoint(String,Binding,Uri)

Adds a service endpoint to the hosted service with a specified contract, binding, and a URI that contains the endpoint address.

public System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint AddServiceEndpoint (string implementedContract, System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding binding, Uri address);
implementedContract
String

The contract implemented by the endpoint.

binding
Binding

The Binding for the endpoint added.

address
Uri

The Uri that contains the address for the endpoint added. This can be an absolute or relative URI. If it is a relative URI, one of the base address of the ServiceHost (depending on the binding protocol) is used as the endpoint's base address.

Returns
ServiceEndpoint

The ServiceEndpoint added to the hosted service.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

implementedContract or binding or address or is null.

InvalidOperationException

The host is not in a CommunicationState or an CommunicationState state or there is no ServiceDescription for the hosted service and so an endpoint cannot be added.

AddServiceEndpoint(String,Binding,String,Uri)

Adds a service endpoint to the hosted service with a specified contract, binding, endpoint address and URI that contains the address at which it listens.

public System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint AddServiceEndpoint (string implementedContract, System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding binding, string address, Uri listenUri);
implementedContract
String

The contract implemented by the endpoint.

binding
Binding

The Binding for the endpoint added.

address
String

The address for the endpoint added. This address can be an absolute or relative URI. If it is a relative URI, one of the base address of the ServiceHost (depending on the binding protocol) is used as the endpoint's base address.

listenUri
Uri

The Uri that contains the address which the endpoint listens to for incoming messages. This URI can be relative or absolute.

Returns
ServiceEndpoint

The ServiceEndpoint added to the hosted service.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

implementedContract or binding or address or is null.

InvalidOperationException

The host is not in a CommunicationState or an CommunicationState state or there is no ServiceDescription for the hosted service and so an endpoint cannot be added.

Remarks

If the address is a relative URI, one of the base addresses of the ServiceHost (depending on the binding protocol) is used as the endpoint's base address.

AddServiceEndpoint(String,Binding,Uri,Uri)

Adds a service endpoint to the hosted service with the specified contract, binding, and URIs that contain the endpoint and listening addresses.

public System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint AddServiceEndpoint (string implementedContract, System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding binding, Uri address, Uri listenUri);
implementedContract
String

The contract implemented by the endpoint.

binding
Binding

The Binding for the endpoint added.

address
Uri

The Uri that contains the address for the endpoint added. If it is a relative URI, one of the base address of the ServiceHost (depending on the binding protocol) is used as the endpoint's base address.

listenUri
Uri

The Uri that contains the address at which the endpoint listens for incoming messages.

Returns
ServiceEndpoint

The ServiceEndpoint added to the hosted service. This URI can be absolute or relative.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

implementedContract or binding or address or is null.

InvalidOperationException

The host is not in a CommunicationState or an CommunicationState state or there is no ServiceDescription for the hosted service and so an endpoint cannot be added.

Loads the service description information from the configuration file and applies it to the runtime being constructed.

When implemented in a derived class, creates the description of the hosted service.

The ServiceDescription for the hosted service.

IncrementManualFlowControlLimit(Int32)

Increases the limit on the flow rate of messages to the hosted service by a specified increment.

public int IncrementManualFlowControlLimit (int incrementBy);

Int32

The number of messages by which to increase the flow control limit.

Returns
Int32

The new limit after the increment is added.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The value is less than zero.

Remarks

This limit can be accessed using the ManualFlowControlLimit property.

Creates and initializes the service host with the contract and service descriptions.

protected void InitializeDescription (System.ServiceModel.UriSchemeKeyedCollection baseAddresses);
baseAddresses
UriSchemeKeyedCollection

A UriSchemeKeyedCollection that contains the base addresses for the service hosted.

InitializeRuntime()

Initializes the runtime for the service host.

protected virtual void InitializeRuntime ();
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

The description of the service hosted is null.

LoadConfigurationSection(ServiceElement)

Loads the service element from the configuration file of the hosted service.

protected void LoadConfigurationSection (System.ServiceModel.Configuration.ServiceElement serviceSection);
serviceSection
ServiceElement

The ServiceElement to be loaded from configuration.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

serviceSection is null.

InvalidOperationException

The description of the service hosted is null.

OnAbort()

Aborts the service.

protected override void OnAbort ();

OnBeginClose(TimeSpan,AsyncCallback,Object)

Begins an asynchronous operation invoked on the close of the service host.

protected override IAsyncResult OnBeginClose (TimeSpan timeout, AsyncCallback callback, object state);
timeout
TimeSpan

The TimeSpan that specifies how long the on-close operation has to complete before timing out.

callback
AsyncCallback

The AsyncCallback delegate that receives the notification of the asynchronous operation on-close completion.

state
Object

An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous on-close operation.

Returns
IAsyncResult

The IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous on-close operation.

OnBeginOpen(TimeSpan,AsyncCallback,Object)

Begins an asynchronous operation invoked on the opening of the service host.

protected override IAsyncResult OnBeginOpen (TimeSpan timeout, AsyncCallback callback, object state);
timeout
TimeSpan

The TimeSpan that specifies how long the on-open operation has to complete before timing out.

callback
AsyncCallback

The AsyncCallback delegate that receives the notification of the asynchronous operation on-open completion.

state
Object

An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous on-open operation.

Returns
IAsyncResult

The IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous on-open operation.

OnClose(TimeSpan)

Closes down the hosted service, including their channel dispatchers and associated instance contexts and listeners.

protected override void OnClose (TimeSpan timeout);
timeout
TimeSpan

The TimeSpan that specifies how long the on-close operation has to complete before timing out.

Remarks

Calling OnClose does the following:

  • Closes all input to ChannelDispatcher, which also closes their associated IChannelListener instances. This stops any new channels from being accepting.

  • Calls CloseInput on all InstanceContext objects, which mean they stop accepting new messages.

  • Waits for all InstanceContext objects to close down, which happens when their associated channels finish sending all pending messages.

  • Closes the ChannelDispatcher objects associated with the host.

OnClosed()

Releases resources used by the service host.

protected override void OnClosed ();

OnEndClose(IAsyncResult)

Completes an asynchronous operation invoked on the closing of the service host.

protected override void OnEndClose (IAsyncResult result);
result
IAsyncResult

The IAsyncResult returned by a call to the stem.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase.OnBeginClose(System.TimeSpan,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object) method.

OnEndOpen(IAsyncResult)

Completes an asynchronous operation invoked on the opening of the service host.

protected override void OnEndOpen (IAsyncResult result);
result
IAsyncResult

The IAsyncResult returned by a call to the stem.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase.OnBeginOpen(System.TimeSpan,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object) method.

OnOpen(TimeSpan)

Opens the channel dispatchers.

protected override void OnOpen (TimeSpan timeout);
timeout
TimeSpan

The TimeSpan that specifies how long the on-open operation has to complete before timing out.

OnOpened()

Gets the service credentials,service authentication and authorization behavior for the hosted service.

protected override void OnOpened ();

Remarks

Once these behaviors are initialized when opening the service, they cannot be changed.

ReleasePerformanceCounters()

Releases the service and channel dispatcher performance counters for the hosted service.

protected void ReleasePerformanceCounters ();

Remarks

This method is invoked when calling OnClose(TimeSpan) and

OnEndClose(IAsyncResult).

SetEndpointAddress(ServiceEndpoint,String)

Sets the endpoint address of the specified endpoint to the specified address.

public void SetEndpointAddress (System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint endpoint, string relativeAddress);
endpoint
ServiceEndpoint

The service endpoint.

relativeAddress
String

The endpoint address.

Events

UnknownMessageReceived

Occurs when an unknown message is received.

public event EventHandler<System.ServiceModel.UnknownMessageReceivedEventArgs> UnknownMessageReceived;

Remarks

Warning

When using WorkflowServiceHost, exposing a hosting endpoint, and a UnknownMessageReceived exception is thrown, the host passes the message to the event handler. If an attempt is made to read this message an InvalidOperationException is thrown. The description of the exception will say “This message cannot support the operation because it has been read.” The WCF infrastructure reads the message while extracting the message parameters. This message is then passed to the event handler and any attempt to read it causes an exception. If you need to access message parameters in your InvalidOperationException handler from a hosting endpoint, define the hosting endpoint contract using MessageContract and place the needed data into a message header. For more information about hosting endpoints see Workflow Service Host Extensibility

Explicit Interface Implementations

IDisposable.Dispose()

Closes the service host.

void IDisposable.Dispose ();
